item.value: The world's shortest alphabet, used in the Solomon Islands, has only 11.
The strongest wind ever recorded wind was on Mt Washington, New Hampshire, USA. It was an amazing 231mph.
The Population of the Earth is about 6,800,000,000 (6.80 billion) people.
The Sputnik 1, launched on October 4, 1957 by Russia, was the first human-made object to orbit the Earth.
Opened in 2010, the Burj Khalifa in Dubai is the tallest building in the world.
Michael Jackson's 1982 Thriller album is the biggest seller of all time. Over 110 millions albums were sold.
The longest word in a major English dictionary is 'Pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis'.
The explosion of Mount Tambora, on Sumbawa island, Indonesia in 1815 was heard 2,600 km (1,600 mi) away and has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
The most widely spoken language is Mandarin, nearly 1 billion people speak it, mainly in China.
In 1783 Sebastien Lenormand was first to demonstrate the parachute. In Missouri 1912, Captain Berry was the first to jump from a plane with a parachute.
Alaska is the largest state in America.
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high. On May 29 1953 Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay were the first to reach the peak.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
The biggest earthquake ever recorded occurred in Chile, in 1960. Known as the Great Chilean Earthquake, the quake measured 9.5 on the Richter scale.
Most people blink about 17,000 times a day.
A sneeze generates a wind of 166 km/hr (100 mi/hr), and a cough moves out at 100 km/hr (60 mi/hr).
The tallest person in the world was Robert Wadlow. He was 2.72 meters ( 8ft 11in ) tall.
The Surface Area of the earth is 197 million square miles, about two thirds of the Earth's surface is covered with water.
Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first telephone in 1876.
Tides are caused by the rotation of the Earth and the gravitational effects of the Moon and Sun.
